title: Hope
main_text:
If you lose hope, somehow you lose the vitality that keeps moving, you lose that courage to be, that quality that helps you go on in spite of it all. And so today I still have a dream.” Martin Luther King Jr.” George Harrison

Work Without Hope by Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Gone With the Wind by Margaret Mitchel

Hope is a Thing with Feathers by Emily Dickinson

He Wishes for the Cloths of Heaven by Yeats

To Hope by John Keats
